C1 used when you want to give more detail or be more exact about something you have just said: We need to get more teachers into the classrooms where they're most needed, namely in high poverty areas. I learned an important lesson when I lost my job, namely that nothing is a hundred percent guaranteed. Synonym
viz. old-fashioned
More examplesFewer examplesI want you to know one thing, namely that if you run up debts, we will not pay them for you.He was active in poorer parts of the church, namely in inner London and Manchester.
